newsitem.title: UK: Beales Hunter down after profit results.
newsitem.headline: Beales Hunter down after profit results.

text.p: Shares in Beales Hunter Plc dropped on Wednesday after the industrial refrigeration group posted a drop in first-half profits and warned of tough trading conditions, traders said.
The stock was off 11 pence at 156-1/2p by 1110 GMT. "They're a little under par," one trader said. "The share price fall is a reflection of the results."
Pre-tax profits fell to 1.5 million stg in the half year to November 30 from 1.6 million the year before, on turnover which rose to 33.2 million stg from 32.5 million.
"Trading conditions during the half year were very difficult with activity levels flat and operating margins under pressure," the company said in a statement.
"Raw material prices remain stable but margins are likely to remain under pressure as customers continue to resist price increases and competitors seek gains in market share."
